metadata.synopsis: After being freed from the Absolute's thrall, Minsc tears his lair apart in the search for Boo. He eventually leads us to a small chamber that had been bricked up, and cautiously creeps in - warning us that it is the lair of a dangerous beast (Boo.)
metadata.how_to_trigger: Debug:1. CTRL+Shift+72. Minsc->Recruit->Minsc & Boo Reunion3. Talk to MinscLegitimate:1. Encounter Minsc in the Counting House and let him escape2. Encounter Minsc again in the Abandoned Cistern. Start combat with him and knock him out3. Start dialog with Minsc after knocking him out4. After the dialog help Minsc destroy the cracked walls in the Abandoned Cistern to find Boo5. Talk to Minsc

34.speaker: Minsc
34.text: You have a great many companions already. There is no room for little Boo, or slightly larger Minsc.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Why don't you wait at my camp instead? I have things to do.

172.speaker: Player
172.text: On second thought - better we part ways here.

115.context: CinematicNodeContext: [SCENE] Minsc and player enter a low dark room. Minsc holds up a hand (the right one), suddenly cautious. He speaks in a stage whisper.

171.speaker: Minsc
171.text: My friend. From our brief sharing of skulls, I know you have faced many strange beings.

55.speaker: Minsc
55.text: But none like this! Whatever happens, show no fear, and stay your hand. Trust in Minsc!
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc poised with his hand up, looking around as if expecting attack at any moment.NodeContext: In a stage whisper, as if we're somewhere incredibly dangerous

52.speaker: Jaheira
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Jaheira, who gives a weary shrug: 'humour him'NodeContext: Line for mocap. Just a slight exasperated sigh and a shrug from Jaheira - Minsc is being odd, player looks to Jaheira, who shrugs wearily as if to say "humour him"

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I do trust you. I think.

19.speaker: Minsc
19.text: Minsc finds that the less thinking he does, the easier the trusting comes.

123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc steps into the centre of the room ...and then STAGGERS as if struck with some force.

84.speaker: Minsc
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over his face, flailing. He falls to his knees dramatically, his back turned to us. He converses with something held in his cupped hands.

9.speaker: Minsc
9.text: You gaze into Minsc's soul and see his foul crimes! You smell the stench of evil upon him, pointy claws primed, ready to scratch out his eyes!

141.speaker: Minsc
141.text: I am sorry, my friend! I am at the mercy of your faultless justice!

150.speaker: Minsc
150.text: Now: if you must burrow through my blackened heart - I am ready.

67.speaker: Minsc
67.text: Such boundless compassion! You are all heart! And whiskers. And cute little nose.

83.speaker: Minsc
83.text: You are right, of course. There is still much evil for Boo and Minsc to stamp out - but we need not fight it alone!

89.speaker: Minsc
89.text: I have a new face to show you. But it is not a villainous one for the clawing, understand?

99.speaker: Minsc
99.text: You, this is Boo. And Boo - meet you.
99.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc turns around and spreads his hands out to player - revealing Boo, looking at us intently. 

Minsc is holding boo in his left hand, upper chest level after the presentationNodeContext:  Turns 180 degree while holding a hamster close to his chest, then spread his hands out. <TarikS>

7.speaker: Minsc
7.text: A miniature giant space hamster. Fear not, you will learn the difference in time.

126.speaker: Minsc
126.text: For every song of Minsc the ranger, they sing ten of the hamster Boo. And not just because his name is easier for the rhyming.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: This is your great beast? Did you hit your head, by any chance?

0.speaker: Minsc
0.text: Of course. How else was I to break through these walls?

168.speaker: Minsc
168.text: Those villains locked Boo away, lest his righteous gaze cause their tadpole to flee in terror.
168.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Boo rinsing himself disinterestedly, very much just a hamster. [Existing idle]

16.speaker: Minsc
16.text: Now we are together again, all will be exactly as -

106.speaker: Minsc
106.text: Boo. Why do you use such language?

69.speaker: Minsc
69.text: ...Once more, my hamster proves himself my greater half, and makes the path clear when my mind is fuzzier than his tiny bottom.

95.speaker: Minsc
95.text: He says we will join with you, and cleanse Baldur's Gate of evil together!

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Can I trust you not to turn on me again, Stone Lord?

152.speaker: Minsc
152.text: I give you my solemn vow - should any of us show signs of weakening to the worm, or any other evil, Boo will slaughter us all in our beds.

144.speaker: Minsc
144.text: I hope this brings you comfort.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Good enough for me. Let's go.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Go to my camp. I have things to do first.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Not enough. You're on your own - I don't need your help.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: It would be an honour - let's go.

148.speaker: Minsc
148.text: You are not the leader of this merry band, I think. Meaning no offence - Boo is the boss of me, after all.
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts the Hamster on his right shoulder (collar bone level) with his left hand, let Boo crawl on his shoulder and in his armour

5.speaker: Minsc
5.text: Miniature as Boo is, he is also giant. You will need to make room for us, my friend.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: All right. I'll meet you at camp later - I have things to do.

145.speaker: Minsc
145.text: Boo and I are most adept in the doing of things. But, as you wish.

142.speaker: Minsc
142.text: To camp, then! For his heroics here today, Boo has earned the most vigorous of back-scratchings.
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts the Hamster on his right shoulder (collar bone level) with his left hand, let Boo crawl on his shoulder and in his armour

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
124.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Gale could do with a rest.

120.speaker: Gale
120.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

17.speaker: Jaheira
17.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
17.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

63.speaker: Karlach
63.context: NodeContext: A bit immature bad attitude. Player has told her to swap with someone else who wants to join the party.

1.speaker: Shadowheart
1.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

157.speaker: Wyll
157.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
6.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: On second thought, we should part ways.

103.speaker: Minsc
103.text: Truly? But... you have seen my hamster, have you not? His stern countenance, his mighty claws, his pointy teeth!

137.speaker: Jaheira
137.text: I did not come so far only to leave him to the mercy of the tadpole again. I'd ask you to reconsider - send him to camp, at least. He will prove useful, despite all appearances.
137.context: NodeContext: Gently chiming in on Minsc's behalf, but making it clear she won't leave him behind.

75.speaker: Minsc
75.text: If you will not be swayed, I will thank you - and go to find Jaheira. She knows the value of a hamster at hand.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Go, Minsc - and take Jaheira with you.

82.speaker: Jaheira
82.text: ...All right. Then I suppose all that remains is for us to thank you - and wish luck to us all.
82.context: NodeContext: A little taken aback that we don't want her or Minsc

48.speaker: Minsc
48.text: As you wish. But Boo and I hope you will change your mind - before the worm changes it for you, eh?
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts the Hamster on his right shoulder (collar bone level) with his left hand, let Boo crawl on his shoulder and in his armour

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Fine. I'll find you at camp.

51.speaker: Minsc
51.text: Your party remains full, and Boo is shy. But we shall sniff out your camp and meet you there.
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Puts the Hamster on his right shoulder (collar bone level) with his left hand, let Boo crawl on his shoulder and in his armour

177.speaker: Minsc
177.text: Get comfortable, Boo. We go to battle, and - ahahaha!
177.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Minsc transfers Boo to his shoulder and strikes a pose, declaiming heroically - then breaks down giggling when Boo crawls inside his armour. 

Puts the Hamster on his right shoulder (collar bone level) with his left hand, let Boo crawl on his shoulder and in his armour and strikes a pose, then laughNodeContext: Puts the Hamster on his right shoulder (collar bone level) with his left hand, let Boo crwl on his shoulder and in his armour and strikes a pose, then laugh. <TarikS>

32.speaker: Minsc
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clearing throat and back to hero mode.NodeContext: Clearing throat and back to hero mode. Glory and glorious death are equally noble.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Secure your rodent and follow me.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: You can go to my camp. I have things to do.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: You can cleanse it on your own. I don't need your help.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: If this is a trap, you die first.

135.speaker: Minsc
135.text: My friend - only cowards lay traps, and Minsc is no coward, so there can be no trap. Yes?

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Can we just get on with... whatever this is?

88.speaker: Minsc
88.text: Such a hurry to our final moments. May I face death as bravely as you do.
